name: RAND Europe (EU) AISBL
memberOrga: RAND Europe (EU) AISBL is registered in Belgium and has two member organisations: RAND Europe Community Interest Company, registered in the UK, and the RAND Corporation, registered in California, USA
goal:
RAND Europe (EU) is an international non-profit association which in conjunction with its members, RAND Europe CIC and the RAND Corporation, undertakes research in Europe. Our mission is to help improve policy and decision-making through research and analysis.

RAND Europe (EU) is able to draw on the depth of expertise of its members across a broad range of EU policy-relevant topics from defence and security, innovation and technology policy, and criminal justice through to health and social issues. Cutting across topical areas are the methods-focused groups, including evaluation and impact measurement, and choice modelling and valuation. The mix of subject expertise, contextual understanding and innovative methodologies creates insightful yet robust analysis.

We share the values of our member organisations.

We are objective. We realise our mission by conducting objective, relevant research and analysis to create solutions that are both effective and enduring. Our research is designed to find ways to apply quantifiable, disciplined analysis to thorny policy questions.

We understand the needs of policymakers. Through diversity of experience and expertise, coupled with our interdisciplinary approach to research and analysis and the innovative methods applied, we can address the needs of policymakers.

We have impact. Whether to advance and inform policy debates, raise an issue up a notch on a policy agenda or to change policy or practice, we work to improve policies that can help people.

We aim to deliver quality. Our research conforms to the quality-assured products for which the RAND name has been known for over 60 years.

We care. We passionately care about policy and serve the public interest by communicating our findings to a wide audience. We strive to be Europeâ€™s trusted source for policy research to benefit the public interest.
interests: Borders and Security, Competition, Consumers, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Foreign affairs and security policy, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Migration and asylum, Public Health, Research and innovation, Single market, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives: RAND Europe, as a research organisation, follows a broad range of EU initiatives with an eye to identifying opportunities to provide evidence-based research to inform the policy agenda. The EU policy areas of most interest include: defence and security; home affairs and migration; research and innovation; digital agenda; education and training; employment and social affairs; public health; justice and consumer protection; foreign policy; transport; and international development. In addition to various service contracts through call for tender, we have a range of framework contracts in place with Directorates General of the European Commission, EU agencies and the European Parliament to provide research studies on topics relevant to the EU.
